column3: Originates from the University of California, Irvine. It has data from four major heart disease research institutions. Contains 76 attributes, but many researchers typically use a subset of 14. It's one of the most commonly used datasets for heart disease prediction.\

A long-term, ongoing cardiovascular study on residents of the city of Framingham, Massachusetts. Provides a wealth of data related to heart diseases and has been pivotal in the identification of risk factors for cardiovascular diseases.\
Part of the UCI dataset but specifically from the Cleveland Clinic Foundation. Often used in its own right because of the quality of data it offers.\
Also from the UCI repository. Contains data like age, sex, chest pain type, resting blood pressure, etc., for predicting the absence or presence of heart disease.\
Available on Kaggle. Consists of 70,000 records of patients with 11 features each. Features include age, gender, systolic blood pressure, cholesterol, etc.\
Specifically for detecting arrhythmias, not general heart disease, but relevant for cardiovascular health. Hosted on PhysioNet and has 48 half-hour excerpts of two-channel ambulatory ECG recordings.\
Another dataset on PhysioNet. Contains data specifically related to congestive heart failure.\
For diagnostic electrocardiography. Has 549 records from 290 subjects. Each record includes a 15 signal, 12 lead ECG.\
